item.title: 8 Most Ambitious Games By Ubisoft, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • ZombiU pushed survival horror boundaries with innovative Wii U technology for an immersive experience.
  • Watch Dogs offered a hacking-based gameplay and interactive environments different from GTA 5.
  • Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Extraction blended tactical realism with horror for a cooperative sci-fi setting.

Ubisoft has consistently pushed the boundaries of what is possible in the world of video games and has continued to push out groundbreaking titles for the past two decades. A lineage of classic titles and IPs like Assassin's Creed and the Tom Clancy series, the company has had no shortage of immense successes throughout its lifespan, and is still looking to break into new ground even today.

Over the years, through sequels and revivals, Ubisoft has tried its hand at making something entirely new or attempted to reimagine a classic genre or title in a completely new way. Some failures, some triumphs, but at the end of the day, the ambition and the will to try something no one else has done before deserve commendation in themselves, and the company has shown that it is not afraid to freshen things up and go for gold.

8 ZombiU

Using The Technology To Its Fullest

Your comment has not been saved

ZombiU
7 /10
8.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montpellier
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U
Powered by

A unique video game on an even more unique console, ZombiU served as an experiment into the world of survival horror, utilizing the technology of the Wii U to create an immersive and distinct experience unlike any other. The title introduced a heightened sense of vulnerability by forcing players to manage their inventory and scan the map across both the handheld screen and the main screen, often exposing them to danger along the way.

The permadeath mechanic was also a bold move that took away the training wheels and thrust players into an incredibly punishing and unforgiving world that could turn sour at any moment. It really tested the player and their ability to take care of their resources and punished mistakes in a way few games at the time would. While the success of the game was limited, it still serves as a testament to Ubisoft's experimental spirit and ambition to redefine how players engage with specific genres.

7 Watch Dogs

Everything Is A Tool

Your comment has not been saved

Watch Dogs
8 /10
8.5 /10
Released
May 26, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature // Blood, Game Experience May Change During Online Play, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Platform(s)
PS4, PS3, Xbox One, Xbox 360, Nintendo Wii U, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

While other games at the time were attempting to emulate the success of GTA 5 , Ubisoft took a different approach and introduced players to an immersive environment where hacking was the main mechanic. Watch Dogs is a particularly ambitious title in that the world was so densely populated with unique NPCs, each with their own traits and personalities, and a city that could be used and exploited in a variety of interesting and fun ways at any moment.

It traded simplistic gunplay for faster, tactical fights that utilized every aspect of the area around to unleash chaos with more than a few explosions. The multiplayer was also a departure from other titles, adding specific modes that leaned into the mechanics of the game, like tailing other players undetected and decrypting files in intense shootouts that rewarded precision and quick thinking. A step in the right direction for the developers and an indication of the potential for open worlds with more interactive environments to come.

6 Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Extraction

Switching Hostages For Alien Parasites

Your comment has not been saved

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Extraction
3.3 /10
Released
January 20, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Drug Reference, Strong Language, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Montreal
Platform(s)
Amazon Luna, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Tom Clancy’s Rainbow Six Extraction represented Ubisoft’s bold attempt to evolve the tactical realism of the Rainbow Six franchise into a cooperative science-fiction setting that players hadn't yet experienced. Departing from the grounded counterterrorism operations that defined earlier entries, Extraction introduced players to containment missions against a mutating alien threat that incorporated far more horror and survival than PvP intensity. Core mechanics from Rainbow Six Siege were reimagined for a PvE environment, emphasizing strategic team coordination, with some interesting additions like permanent operator injuries, escalating risk-reward systems, and procedural mission modifiers, highlighting Ubisoft’s ambition to infuse tactical shooters with roguelike elements and long-term progression challenges.

On a technical level, the game leveraged the sophisticated destruction systems and precise gunplay perfected in Siege , but expanded them with environmental hazards and evolving enemy types to keep the game feeling fresh and the difficulty constantly evolving. By blending methodical team tactics with unpredictable and horrifying enemies, Ubisoft aimed to bridge the gap between hardcore tactical simulation and broader cooperative survival experiences, delivering a distinct hybrid within the multiplayer shooter genre.

5 Space Junkies

A Bold Move Into The VR Shooter Space

Space Junkies

Released
March 26, 2019
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4
Powered by

VR is very much a medium for video games, which is a mixed bag of successes and struggles that has yet to overtake the mainstream in a big way. Space Junkies looked to subvert the expectations on the VR space, by introducing a competitive multiplayer shooter that sought to redefine the genre and demonstrate that skill-based multiplayer games in the world of VR, could potentially be the next big step in gaming.

From a technical standpoint, Space Junkies certainly delivered on the fluid movement and fast-paced combat that it set out to create, at a time where the hardware was very much still evolving. It stood as a game that wanted to look forward to and have a vision for the future of multiplayer shooters, and while it didn't break out to a wide audience, it was still a significant milestone in the pursuit of high-quality, skill-based multiplayer experiences in VR.

4 The Crew

An Entire Country's Worth Of Content

Your comment has not been saved

The Crew
7.0 /10
Released
December 2, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Language, Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Ivory Tower, Ubisoft Reflections
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

The Crew represented Ubisoft taking a leap into creating an immensely large and diverse open-world that players had never seen before. A scaled-down version of the USA that incorporated role-playing and seamless transitions across the landscape, it was a truly groundbreaking game that took the idea of an online racing game and destroyed all the limits to build one of the best and most memorable games in Ubisoft's catalog.

The online aspects of the game were particularly well-integrated and demonstrated that smaller scope environments were a thing of the past when it came to building a racing game that players actually wanted to play. A new benchmark for the genre, and despite being taken offline, the sequels capture all the same strengths and go above and beyond thanks to the ambition and scope of the original.

3 Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands

Tactical Shooting In An Expansive Environment

Your comment has not been saved

Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon Wildlands
8 /10
7.7 /10
Released
March 7, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Fair
Powered by

Taking the Tom Clancy name and placing it into a gigantic open-world, Wildlands allowed players to explore a vast, cartel-controlled environment with all the freedom they could ever want. Combining the precision and tactical aspects of other games in the series, it combined it with a sandbox design that encouraged players to venture out and take down the various threats across the world, however they chose.

The world itself is almost absurd in its detail, including a day-night cycle, dynamic weather, and AI-driven enemy behaviors that continued to provide an evolving experience that never felt the same. The sheer scale and depth of the landscape are an achievement on their own, and combined with rewarding and satisfying co-op gunplay, Wildlands stands out as one of the best in the Ghost Recon series and a new standard for open-world shooters in modern-day settings.

2 Star Wars Outlaws

Bringing The Classic To The Open World

Your comment has not been saved

Star Wars Outlaws
7 /10
60
6.9 /10
Released
August 30, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Simulated Gambling, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Massive Entertainment
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

Star Wars Outlaws marked a significant evolution in Ubisoft's approach to game design, departing from its traditional formula to deliver a more organic and immersive experience in a world that is so beloved and revered. Players engage in high-risk missions, interact with various factions, and make choices that influence Kay's reputation and the game's progression. Taking an IP like Star Wars and attempting to create any title is no easy feat, and Outlaws attempted to set itself apart with a more dynamic and self-determined experience.

The game features a companion system with Nix, an alien creature assisting in combat and puzzle-solving, adding depth to the gameplay and mixing up the fights in interesting ways. Space combat is expertly integrated, allowing players to pilot the Trailblazer starship in dogfights and planetary navigation. Despite some backlash and resistance from the consumer base, the game's innovative design and faithful representation of the Star Wars universe have been praised, establishing it as a noteworthy entry in the franchise.

1 Skull And Bones

AAA Just Simply Wasn't Enough

Your comment has not been saved

Skull and Bones
5 /10
3.3 /10
Released
February 16, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Ubisoft Singapore
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Weak
Powered by

One of the most ambitious games of all time and a game whose development cycle spans more than a decade, Skull and Bones emerged as one of Ubisoft’s most daring titles that coined a new term, "AAAA Game." Stepping back into the world of pirate-themed action, building on the naval combat mechanics first introduced in Assassin’s Creed 4: Black Flag , the game thrusts players into a land of ruthless maritime warfare, where ship combat, exploration, and resource management form the core gameplay. With its emphasis on tactical ship battles, the game aimed to refine and expand upon the ship-centric gameplay that Black Flag popularized, offering both PvP and PvE elements that allowed for expansive multiplayer interactions.

The game is graphically impressive, ensuring that all the important physics related to weather and the environment are visually striking and immersive. Though the game faced delays and criticism for a lack of clear direction, the gameplay and world really speak for themselves, and it demonstrates that Ubisoft is willing to take risks with large-scale projects, even if it means keeping it behind closed doors for a little bit longer.

item.title: InZOI's Next Major Update Should Do Battle with The Sims on a New Front
item.description:
Life-simulation fans have been eagerly watching InZOI carve out its identity in a genre long dominated by The Sims . While InZOI already boasts stunning visuals and a more dynamic take on daily life, the fact that the game is still in Early Access means that it has a long way to go before it can market itself as a finished product.

With upcoming updates for InZOI , the game is slowly shaping itself to deliver hot-commodity features that will make it stand out as the life-sim game to beat in the genre. However, there’s one major frontier it could claim to truly stand apart from other life-sims. By embracing a fresh, imaginative concept that other titles have barely scratched the surface of, InZOI could carve out a space all its own and captivate players in entirely new ways—in a spookier manner, even.

InZOI Should Embrace The Supernatural and Paranormal

The Sims introducing occult and supernatural lifeforms changed how players manipulate stories and households. As the true monarch of imaginative supernatural sims, The Sims remains undefeated in this category due to the sheer breadth of content available for players leaning towards the otherworldly. Nevertheless, InZOI has the opportunity to stand out. By introducing the supernatural, InZOI could get up to speed with the different occult life forms available in The Sims 4 . But rather than treading familiar ground with vampires, aliens, or werewolves, InZOI has the perfect opportunity to tap into lesser-explored territory by introducing cryptids, urban legends, and mythological oddities to spice up gameplay.

Cryptids are the Perfect Choice for InZOI

Instead of the same familiar creatures that could offer predictable gameplay features, InZOI could embrace cryptids: creatures from folklore, local superstition, and conspiracy theories that are full of mystery and intrigue. Cryptids are popular in horror games, but InZOI could introduce them to the life-sim genre to make them less scary. From the Mothman and Chupacabra to new, game-original legends, cryptids would offer a different kind of supernatural flavor. They’re tied to regional myths, bringing a rich cultural texture that could vary by in-game neighborhood or even player choices.

Players could have encounters ranging from full-blown abductions like The Sims 4 to blessings, depending on how they interact with these mysterious beings. Befriending a cryptid might unlock secret traits, hidden locations, or rare objects, giving players even more control over their stories. It would also open the door for light horror or cozy mystery aesthetics, two storytelling angles that are highly popular but frankly underutilized in life-sims like The Sims .

Why the Supernatural Matters in Life-Sims

For a game genre that is characterized by playing at life, supernatural gameplay is surprisingly some of the most requested and sought-after features and playthrough routes for sims. In fact, The Sims ’ supernatural-leaning DLC has been some of its most popular. Players love breaking free from everyday realism to explore darker or more fantastical storylines. However, The Sims tends to revisit the same creatures over and over. And in The Sims 4 , Maxis has trimmed the supernatural gameplay options into individualized DLC instead of one huge expansion like The Sims 3 Supernatural expansion pack. Vampires and aliens, for example, have become almost expected additions rather than exciting surprises.

Players yearning for a fresh twist could find it in a game like InZOI , where the rules of the world are still being defined. Adding a supernatural layer would also provide players with new systems to interact with, beyond career ladders or social relationships. Imagine a character tracking mysterious footprints around their neighborhood, or accidentally stumbling into a ritual that alters the gameplay. It would encourage exploration, experimentation, and storytelling in a way that feels fresh even in a life-sim genre stacked with great games.

Taking a Different Path Than The Sims

By focusing on cryptids and folklore, InZOI would avoid direct comparisons to The Sims ' usual supernatural content while still offering the fantasy layer players love. It would also allow developers to tap into fan theories, user-generated myths, and even live-service-style updates, where new legends appear over time. Instead of just being another game with vampires and zombies, InZOI could become a life sim where anything could be lurking just out of sight. It would deepen the game’s personality and give players endless new mysteries to solve and stories to tell.

7 Images
7 Images

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed
InZOI
Life Simulation
Systems
9 /10
21
8.2 /10
OpenCritic Reviews
Top Critic Avg: 82 /100 Critics Rec: 86%
Released
March 28, 2025
Developer(s)
Krafton
Publisher(s)
Krafton
Engine
Unreal Engine 5

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

inZOI is a life simulation game where the player can alter any aspect of their world to create unique stories and experiences. Just like in the real world, you can find jobs to make a living while forming deep relationships through interactions. With a complete community simulation of every character acting on their free will, you can experience unexpected events to feel the various emotions life has to offer. With inZOI, we hope to share the message that "life itself is the true gift, and every journey has its own meaning."

inZOI provides a variety of creative tools, so that players can visualize the life they've always dreamed of. Developed using Unreal Engine 5, the game's realistic graphics allows the players to let their imagination run free, with easy creation of different resources. Customize your character's appearance and outfit and build your custom home using a wide selection of freely-movable furniture and structures. You can also adjust different parts of your property and surrounding roads as well as aspects of your residing city for a fully customizable experience.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Fan Shares Lord of the Rings Skin Concepts
item.description:
Summary

  • A fan created imaginative Lord of the Rings skin concepts for Overwatch 2 heroes.
  • Transformations include Mercy as Galadriel and Reinhardt as Sauron.
  • Overwatch 2 fans eagerly await new collaborations, like the recent Gundam Wing skins.

An Overwatch 2 fan has shared Lord of the Rings skin concepts for heroes such as Mercy, Ramattra, and Sombra. The artwork is part of a long list of fan art shared by the Overwatch 2 community, which often shows inventiveness when coming up with ideas for new cosmetics.

There are many examples, such as the Cyberpunk 2077 skin concepts for Overwatch 2 shared by a fan, turning heroes like Cassidy into Johnny Silverhand, Keanu Reeves' character, and Genji into V, the protagonist of CD Project Red's game. In another equally creative project, a second fan transformed Kiriko into 2B, the main character in NieR: Automata , achieving an impressive result with their skin concept. This time, another Overwatch 2 fan used their creativity and designed several skin ideas using a popular movie as inspiration.

On Reddit, user TheKetamineEmperor shared their Lord of the Rings concepts for Kiriko, Tracer, and 14 other heroes. The first batch of skins shows Legolas as Hanzo, combining the two iconic archers. Torbjorn appears as Gimli, and Mercy, one of the Overwatch 2 heroes with many skins, gets a makeover as Galadriel. Lifeweaver and Illari got concepts inspired by the half-elves Elrond and Arwen. At the same time, Widowmaker, Moira, and Sigma have been transformed into Shelob, the Witch King of Angmar, and Saruman.

Inventive Overwatch 2 Concept Turns Heroes Into Lord of the Rings Characters

The second batch of fan art transforms Reinhardt into Sauron, one of Middle-earth's greatest villains. Mei, Sombra, Tracer, and Kiriko have been given skin concepts based on the Hobbits, Samwise, Frodo, Pippin, and Merry, transforming the quartet into one of the races from J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved universe. In a creative connection, Brigitte's skin concept depicts her as Eowyn, and Ramattra as Gandalf. This concept in particular stands out for portraying the popular wizard in two different forms, reflecting Ramattra's changes.

Blizzard has not yet hinted that it plans to release a collaboration based on Lord of the Rings . However, with several crossovers released since the first one in 2023, players are waiting to discover if this collab might come in a future update. Meanwhile, the Gundam Wing skins have been released, dressing Mercy, Reaper, Soldier: 76, and Ramattra as some of the iconic mechs from the popular Japanese series. The collaboration was released on April 29, and until May 12 players can purchase the skins through bundles and complete in-game challenges to earn additional cosmetics.

item.title: Dying Light 1 & 2: Why You Should Start Over in 2025
item.description:
Even 10 years after the original game was released, the Dying Light franchise’s signature parkour-combat still sets it apart from its competition. So, especially for players who haven’t played the original Dying Light or Dying Light 2 Stay Human recently, or at all, these games are highly worth revisiting.

With a new Dying Light game coming out soon, right now is a great time to play the existing two games for a fresh playthrough in 2025, to get a refresher on Kyle Crane’s ongoing story before the next chapter becomes available in Dying Light: The Beast . Otherwise, returning players who haven’t played either of the games in a while might be pleasantly surprised by some of the latest updates and new content available.

Why Now Is the Best Time to Play the Original Dying Light

Refresh on Kyle Crane’s Unfinished Story Ahead of Dying Light: The Beast’s Release This Year

Although the release of Dying Light: The Beast lies ahead, players have plenty of time to revisit the original Dying Light to relive Kyle Crane’s journey so far before experiencing the next chapter in his journey. Not to mention, with the fan-favorite The Following DLC being a canon part of this journey, this is the perfect excuse for another playthrough of this beloved DLC.

Dying Light: The Beast doesn’t have an exact release date yet, though it’s anticipated to be released sometime in 2025.

By now, the original Dying Light has celebrated its 10th anniversary, and its unique parkour elements in both exploration and combat make it a one-of-a-kind game to this day. This is admittedly a lot to say considering how much competition there is among open-world Action RPGs set in a zombie apocalypse, yet still, the original Dying Light stands out among recent zombie games, making it worth a revisit even in 2025, for both the opportunity to relive Kyle Crane’s journey and to once again get immersed in the game’s stylish appeal.

Why Now Is the Best Time to Play Dying Light 2 Stay Human

Experience all the Latest New Content and Improvements from Dying Light 2’s Post-Launch Updates

While Techland has already clarified where and when each game fits into the official Dying Light franchise timeline, it’s unclear to what degree the characters and events from Dying Light 2 will tie into Dying Light: The Beast . However, Dying Light 2 is still worth revisiting in 2025, regardless of the next game in the franchise coming soon, particularly to experience some of the latest new content and updates for the game.

The Biggest Post-Launch Updates for Dying Light 2 Stay Human So Far

  • Repeatable Bounties and other new open-world activities
  • Legend Levels endgame progression system
  • Bloody Ties DLC
  • Combat and Parkour system overhauls
  • New Game+
  • Guns
  • Official mod support
  • Tower Raid rogue-lite game mode

Dying Light 2 is said to have a five-year plan for post-launch support. So far, there have been several major changes and new additions added to the game, enough so that returning players might have new content and endgame progression systems to experience. As of early 2025, there are still two more years left of ongoing support planned for Dying Light 2 , so players can look out for plenty more content and improvements to come as well.

As part of Dying Light 2 ’s plans for future updates, Techland has offered an open invite for players' suggestions and wishlists regarding particular features, like the new Tower Raid permanent game mode. So, while players might be considering waiting to revisit the game until after its final content update is available a couple of years from now, the benefit of returning now, in 2025, is that players can participate in shaping the game’s future.

item.title: Final Fantasy: 8 Strongest Limit Breaks In The Series, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Powerful Limit Breaks in Final Fantasy change the tide of battle against tough bosses.
  • Clive, Tidus, and Zack all have unique Limit Breaks that make them formidable fighters.
  • Understanding characters' abilities and mastering Limit Breaks are crucial for success in battles.

Final Fantasy is a series full of amazing combat moves that dish out a ton of damage. This is especially true in the case of Limit Breaks, where desperate characters channel all their rage and fury to unleash devastating attacks.

The best Limit Breaks in the series can be used reliably, boast a ton of power, and can eliminate enemies in no time. These powerful Limit Breaks can change the tide of battle in a flash, making them invaluable against the toughest bosses in their respective Final Fantasy games.

8 Semi-Prime

Clive Can Channel The Power Of Ifrit

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 16
10 /10
12
9.0 /10
Released
June 22, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

After realizing that he could wield the power of Ifrit, Clive's Limit Break gauge was finally unlocked. After filling up this bar to a certain extent, he could Semi-Prime himself and channel Ifrit's fiery power to beat his foes to a pulp.

This Limit Break can be used frequently to let Clive unleash supercharged attacks on his foes. It may not be the most powerful Limit Break in the series, but its lack of battle-ending power is made up for by the sheer frequency with which Clive can enter this state in battle.

7 Blitz Ace

Tidus Hits Enemies Multiple Times Before Blasting Them With A Blitzball

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 10
19
9.7 /10
Released
December 17, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Blood, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Tidus is a protagonist who takes a while to win over players, with his personality being rather overbearing at first. However, his earnestness and stubborn nature eventually win over players, especially when they see what he's willing to do to save Yuna and the world of Spira itself.

This is a sentiment that somewhat applies to his ultimate Overdrive, too. At first glance, seeing him whip his sword around a few times before punting a blitzball at his opponent isn't all that appealing. Eventually, this Overdrive becomes fun to use, especially with the added detail that the character Tidus has the strongest bond with, will throw the ball he smacks with a Jecht Shot to pulverize his foes.

6 Digital Mind Wave

Zack's Emotions Help Him Channel The Powers He Learns From His Friends

Your comment has not been saved

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 Reunion
9.0 /10
Released
December 13, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen due to Blood, Violence
Powered by

Crisis Core: Final Fantasy 7 boasts one of the most unique Limit Break systems in the series. Zack has constant access to a Digital Mind Wave, appearing as a slot machine that lets him use powerful attacks if certain characters align.

Zack calls upon the bonds he shares with other characters to utilize altered versions of their moves in battle. It helps combat appear flashy while also having a narrative significance that highlights Zack's friendships.

5 Highwind

Cid Calls His Airship To Launch A Bombardment On Foes

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 7
16
8.9 /10
Released
January 31, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Cid has one of the most diabolical Limit Breaks in the entire series. He can bring Highwind's ballistic powers into battle, launching eighteen missiles at targets for immense damage.

It's a ridiculously powerful attack, to the point where fans wonder why Highwind isn't tailing the party in every battle to help them enjoy the power of these explosive missiles. This Limit Break alone is enough to convince players to keep Cid in their party against the toughest boss fights in the game.

4 Lion Heart

Squall Cuts Enemies Down To Size With His Powerful Limit Break

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 8
11
9.7 /10
Released
February 11, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Squall's Renzokuken is a powerful Limit Break that can end with a finishing blow for the ages. His ultimate attack is Lion Heart, which is unlocked only after players craft his strongest weapon.

Lion Heart hits multiple times for immense damage before dropping enemies on their heads. This adds insult to injury for an over-the-top attack that is strong enough to one-shot most bosses with ease.

3 Duel

Zell's Limit Break Can Be Optimized To Deal The Most Damage In The Game

Final Fantasy 8 veterans are aware of how exploitable Duel is in the right hands. Trying to build up to a finishing blow is fun in its own way, but the true strength of Zell's Duel comes when players input the simplest commands quickly to rack up the damage numbers.

In capable hands, Zell's Duel is capable of inflicting more damage than Squall's Lion Heart, which is no mean feat. Landing Punch Rush and Booya over and over again may not be all that engaging, but it's a strategy players should prioritize against the strongest bosses in the game.

2 Omnislash Version 5

With His Fusion Swords, Cloud Can Unleash One Of The Most Flamboyant Limit Breaks

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy VII: Advent Children
PG-13
Action
Drama
Animation
Adventure
Release Date
September 14, 2022
Runtime
101 minutes
Director
Tetsuya Nomura

Powered by

Final Fantasy 7: Advent Children may boast more style than substance, but this isn't necessarily a bad thing. After all, the flashy combat sequences are a joy to witness in this movie, especially with the reveal of Cloud's new Fusion Sword.

After being pushed to the limit against Sephiroth in their final battle, Cloud's rage overflows, and he unveils a flashier version of the Omnislash that looks incredible. He sends all the blades of his Fusion Sword into the air, using them to chain a multitude of attacks that put Sephiroth down for the count as the hero saves Gaia once again.

1 Armiger Unleashed

Noctis' Strongest Limit Break Is No Joke

Your comment has not been saved

Final Fantasy 15
9 /10
8.2 /10
Released
November 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Language, Mild Blood, Partial Nudity, Violence

Final Fantasy 15: Royal Edition is easily the best version of this video game that fans can enjoy. It enhances various sections of the game, comes bundled with all the DLC, and lets Noctis enjoy an upgraded version of his Limit Break.

Armiger Unleashed is ridiculously powerful and can decimate the strongest enemies in the game with ease. It's a testament to the Crown Prince's boundless power that the mightiest enemies around will bow to Armiger Unleashed's might once players master their moveset in this state.
